text:
e="preserve">Claudia Anne Winkleman (born 15 January 1972) is an English television presenter, film critic, radio personality, and journalist. Between 2004–2010, she presented ' on weekdays on BBC Two. Since 2010, she has co-presented "Strictly Come Dancing"<nowiki/>'s main results show on Sunday nights with Tess Daly on BBC One and since 2014 has been a main co-host alongside Daly on the Saturday night live shows, following the departure of Bruce Forsyth CBE. She has twice been nominated for the British Academy Television Award for Best Entertainment Performance for her work on "Strictly Come Dancing."
Winkleman was also the presenter of the BBC's "Film...", replacing Jonathan Ross after move to ITV in 2010.

annotations.surface_form: British Academy Television Award for Best Entertainment Performance
